title: GROWING INTO MATURITY

DISCUSSION.title: Technical skills – (e.g. proficiency in software or tools)

title: APPROPRIATE SKILLS FOR PERFORMANCE

memory_verse: : 2 Tim. 3:17 - That the man of God may be perfect, thoroughly furnished unto all good works.
objective: To help us identify necessary steps to developing appropriate skills and realize that the Holy Spirit works through our skills

By developing appropriate skills, individuals can improve their performance and advance in their roles. Dan 2:48.
Discussion_title: The following are some steps individuals can adopt for skill development, in pursuit of fulfilling Divine mandate:

DISCUSSION.title: Identify the skills required: Determine the skills necessary for your goal, job, or industry

Assess your current skills: Evaluate your strengths and weaknesses to pinpoint areas for improvement. Also, identify your natural endowments and/or other skills received from the Holy Spirit you need to improve
Set learning objectives: Create specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART) goals for skill development
Seek training and education, make appropriate consultations: Enroll in courses, apprenticeships, attend workshops, conferences, or webinars, and read relevant books or articles
Practice and apply: Put your new skills into action through projects, volunteering, or real-world applications
Seek feedback and mentorship: Ask for constructive feedback and guidance from experienced professionals.

title: DEALING WITH ADDICTIONS
subtitle: NATURE OF ADDICTIONS
memory_verse: 1 Cor. 10:23 - "All things are lawful for me, but all things are not expedient: all things are lawful for me, but I will NOT BE BROUGHT UNDER THE POWER OF ANY."
objective: What addiction is, and
INTRODUCTION: Addiction is a state in which a person's volition over a choice of behavior is lost. It is a situation where an individual is no longer in control of his or her choice over a particular kind of behavior(s). The person's will has been overtaken by the object of the addiction. At this stage, a person is in bondage to the addiction and cannot free himself or herself without external help. This is what Apostle James refers to as sin, which, when fully grown, leads to death (James 1:15).
Discussion_title: Types of Addictions

DISCUSSION.title: Non-Sinful Addictions: These various behavioral patterns are not explicitly outlawed in the scriptures but have the potential to control our lives. They are not identified in the Holy Scriptures as sinful, yet they can become so tightly woven into our lives that it becomes difficult to let them go, the little foxes. They constitute weights that affect our yield to the workings and dealings of God in our lives. Examples include a penchant for certain foods or drinks, a preference for particular clothing styles, excessive use of mobile phones, or an obsession with watching non-provocative programs or playing games

Sinful Addictions: These behavioral patterns are clearly described as works of the flesh in the scriptures. They bring us into direct conflict with the will and ordinances of God as expressed in the scriptures when we engage in them

CONCLUSION: We must beware of the devil's schemes because his intention is not just to make us breach God's principles but to bring us into bondage through any behavior, whether legitimate or illegitimate.

title: DEALING WITH ADDICTIONS
subtitle: THE PATHWAY TO ADDICTIONS
memory_verse: James 1:13-15 - "Let no one say when he is tempted, 'I am tempted by God'; for God cannot be tempted by evil, nor does He Himself tempt anyone. But each one is tempted when he is drawn away by his own desires and enticed. Then, when desire has conceived, it gives birth to sin; and sin, when it is fully grown, brings forth death" (NKJV).
objective: The pathway through which addictions take hold of a person, and
INTRODUCTION: Addiction is not sudden but progresses through certain defined stages. These stages are the pathways through which addiction comes and takes control. When a person's gates are not secured against the activities that lead to addiction, the inevitable is bound to happen. According to Apostle James, the pathway into addiction is: Temptation & Sin & Death (Addiction).
Discussion_title: Pathways of addiction

DISCUSSION.title: Temptation: The first stage in the addiction where a person is drawn by his or her own lust and enticed. It is the pulling stage with strong attraction and desire for immediate gratification.
Sin: The stage where evil desire is conceived, the person appreciates and accepts the suggestion(s) to indulge the evil desire (temptation). Actions are initiated, and sin is committed.
Death (Addiction): The stage where a person repeatedly commits the sinful act.
Dealing with the pathways of addiction;
Structure your life with personal accountability to others
Keep your heart from evil thoughts
Maintain a prayer life and personal bible reading

CONCLUSION: Every believer must understand the pathway through which addiction or death comes in and guard against the enemy taking a foothold in our lives.

memory_verse: Acts 10:38 - How God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power, who went about doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil for God was with him.
objective: Helping us see the benefits of God's power for our daily living as believers
INTRODUCTION: God's power is central to the Christian Walk, offering believers a source of strength. The benefits of God's power manifest in various aspects of the Christian life both secular and in kingdom service. Understanding these benefits can create a hunger for more of God.

DISCUSSION.title: Power for effective service (God’s house, secular society etc.)
Power for effective Evangelism and Missions
Power to destroy the hold of sin
To empower us to rule over principality and power

CONCLUSION: God's power in our lives presents numerous opportunities. We must endeavor to seek Him more for greater kingdom exploits.

title: CHARACTER
subtitle: CHARACTER DEFECT I - WHAT IS IT?
memory_verse: Matt. 7:16 - You can identify them by their fruit, that is, by the way they act. Can you pick grapes from thornbushes, or figs from thistles?
objective: Define character and understand its importance
INTRODUCTION: Our character represents the inner fabric of our lives, evident through actions and choices without necessarily uttering a word or public declarations. Reputation reflects how others perceive us, but character eventually reveals who we truly are, especially over time. Character defects refer to aspects of behavior or personality that conflict with our values or professed beliefs, causing harm or inconsistency in our lives.

DISCUSSION.title: Defining Character: Character comprises the qualities that shape actions, attitudes, and reactions
Character vs. Reputation: Character is who you truly are; reputation is what others perceive
Influence of Thoughts: Thoughts are the starting point for character, impacting intentions and actions
Biblical Examples of Reputation and/or Character
Satan’s pride – from grace to grass
The Church in Sardis and Laodicea

CONCLUSION: As Proverbs 4:23 advises, guard your heart because it shapes your character and actions. Carry out a litmus test: does your character perfectly align with the Kingdom's value, or are you missing the mark?

title: CHARACTER
subtitle: CHARACTER DEFECT II - IDENTIFYING THEM
memory_verse: Proverbs 28:6 - Better is the poor that walketh in his uprightness than he that is perverse in his ways, though he be rich.
objective: Understand the place of Gifting and Character
INTRODUCTION: Our gifts, talent, and gifting are blessings from God (John 3:27). Hence, the balance between using gifts for kingdom purpose and avoiding prideful corruption requires vigilance. Gifts can bring attention, but character is what sustains respect and trust. How do we then identify and take cognizance of the little foxes?

DISCUSSION.title: Gifts will make us known, but without character can lead to downfall
Charisma without Character could be catastrophic. Anointing and lack of Character could end up in destiny crash. Samson
Here are some Character Defects below, but not limited to:

CONCLUSION: Gifts may be seen outwardly, but character is revealed through trials. Identifying our character flaws allows us to work towards growth in integrity and humility.

title: CHARACTER
subtitle: CHARACTER DEFECT III - OVERCOMING THEM
memory_verse: 1 Cor. 15:33 - Be not deceived: evil communications corrupt good manners.
objective: To emphasize the role of the Word of God and the Holy Spirit in character transformation.
INTRODUCTION: Our CHARACTER is the foundation of our worth. Our Character is influenced from within and shaped by what we often relate with. A good heart will yield positive results, while an evil heart will give bad results. By consistently reflecting on God's word, we can align ourselves with God's nature, allowing for true change.

DISCUSSION.title: Transformation begins with Christ being fully formed in us
Be open, carry out a life inventory
Expose yourself to the Word of God
Cultivate and nurture the fruit of the Holy Spirit to overcome character defects
Be patient with growth and mastery
Shun the wrong cycle of friends
Accountability – spiritual oversight and godly peers

CONCLUSION: Transformation of character is ongoing, requiring constant dedication to God's Word, obedience, and fellowship with other believers. This environment fosters growth and the elimination of flaws that hinder our spiritual growth.

title: CHARACTER
subtitle: CHARACTER DEFECT IV - TRANSFORMATION/ITS IMPACT
memory_verse: Galatians 2:20 - I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless, I live; yet not I, but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me.
objective: Understand how true character transformation takes place
INTRODUCTION: Though we may confess Christ as Lord, true character transformation requires surrender and daily refinement through God's Word, in other words, death to self and alive to Christ. This growth enables us to truly reflect Christ's character, living true to our call as His disciples and to our identity as Christians (Christ-like).
Discussion_title: Essentials for transformation

DISCUSSION.title: Fruitfulness: a life aligned with Christ naturally produce good fruit
Devotion to prayer and His word
Woes of an untransformed character or life

CONCLUSION: Character transformation is a deliberate journey that requires spiritual discipline and dependence on Christ. By allowing the Word to refine us, we can overcome character defects and live fully in God's purpose and for His glory.

title: ANGER
subtitle: DEFINITION AND ORIGIN OF ANGER
memory_verse: Eccl. 7:9- Be not hasty in thy spirit to be angry: for anger resteth in the bosom of fools.
objective: Understanding what Anger is
INTRODUCTION: Anger is the general term for a sudden outburst of displeasure that sometimes could be violent. It is a strong feeling aroused by injury, injustice, wrong, etc. Anger outburst could be deep and justified at cruelty or against corruption. In some other instances, it could be a deep reaction to failure, regret over personal actions, rejection, complex and jealousy.

DISCUSSION.title: Anger is God-given emotion of displeasure
Anger could either be constructive, if handled correctly, or destructive, if not well handled
Anger could be a negative reaction to failure, personal loss, regret over personal actions, rejection, and jealousy
Sin is the origin of unholy anger and it can lead to more sin

CONCLUSION: Anger is a God-given emotion of displeasure. It is a response to a real or perceived wrong. However, we must be in full control of our emotions and channel our anger towards achieving righteousness.

title: ANGER
subtitle: CAUSES OF ANGER
memory_verse: Proverbs 14:17 - A quick-tempered man acts foolishly, and a man of wicked intentions is hated.
objective: X-ray factors that causes anger
INTRODUCTION: Anger typically develops as a response to unwanted actions of another person who is perceived to be disrespectful, demeaning, threatening of neglectful. It is often a reaction to and distraction from inner suffering - feelings such as sadness, powerlessness, shame, anxiety, inadequacies and isolation.

DISCUSSION.title: Anger is justified if it leads to repentance, reconciliation and restoration

CONCLUSION: We should avoid anger by all means (Jas. 1:20). Anger is only justified if it leads to repentance, reconciliation and restoration. Before you get angry at anyone, check yourself first for any shortcomings to correct, and like God asked Cain, always ask Why am I angry?

title: ANGER
subtitle: HOW TO MANAGE ANGER
memory_verse: Pro 19:11- If you are sensible, you will control your temper. When someone wrongs you, it is a great virtue to ignore it. - GNB
objective: To understand biblical provisions to overcoming anger
INTRODUCTION: Anger outbursts are common in our current climate filled with anxieties, political tensions, and disagreements over various cultural and moral issues. It's not uncommon to encounter bitter criticism online as well as in places as mundane as the Market and stores. It's easy for Christians to get caught up in the spirit of things, but the problem with unbridled anger is that it often leads us down the wrong path.
Discussion_title: How to manage your anger.

DISCUSSION.title: Do not live in hate or bitterness
Avoid association with people that are prone to anger
Leave the scene before quarrels break out
Deal with your anger; refuse to be a fool

CONCLUSION: Anger that is not well managed can destroy hence the need to recognize that as humans we are prone to anger, and as such we must deliberately work upon ourselves to properly manage the anger. For the wrath of man worketh not the righteousness of God - Jas. 1:20.

title: ANGER
subtitle: CONSEQUENCES OF UNCONTROLLED ANGER
memory_verse: Jas 1:20- Anger does not help you live the way God wants. (ERV)
objective: We consider the consequences of uncontrolled Anger.
INTRODUCTION: People who indulge in uncontrolled anger tend to underestimate the consequences. Uncontrolled anger is neither instructive nor corrective, rather it is destructive. It does not build up, rather it pulls down. It does not heal, rather it wounds. It solves nothing but succeeds in getting everything more complicated.

DISCUSSION.title: Uncontrolled anger causes the Holy Spirit to withdraw from a life.
Devil is given a legal ground to operate
It destroys relationships – David and Nabal

CONCLUSION: Anger can destroy lives, tear relationships apart, and ruin a believer's witness. The apostle Paul understood the negative potential of resentment, and he offered this advice on how to deal with it: Let all bitterness and wrath and anger and clamor and slander be put away from you, along with all malice.

title: STRIFE AND CONFLICTS
subtitle: UNDERSTANDING STRIFE AND CONFLICTS
memory_verse: Romans 12:18: "If it is possible, as far as it depends on you, live at peace with everyone."
objective: To know what is Strife and Conflicts
INTRODUCTION: When you look at the world today, you will see there is a quantum of strife, conflicts contention, dissension. Defined as a strong ongoing conflict over a fundamental issue. Strife is deeper than argument, broader than disagreement, it involves bitterness and sometimes violence. Strife among believers stains the testimony of the church and brings dishonor to the name of Christ.
Discussion_title: Causes of Strife and Conflicts. Understanding the root causes of conflict is essential to avoiding and solving it.
CONCLUSION: Strife can become a canker worm that can eat deep into the unity, growth and peace of homes, church and relationships. The good news is that, it can be avoided and resolved when we understand its causes. May God help us to be conscious and watchful of these pointers in Jesus name!

title: STRIFE AND CONFLICTS
subtitle: PURPOSE OF STRIFE AND CONFLICTS
memory_verse: 2 Timothy 2:24-25 (KJV)  And the servant of the Lord must not strive; but be gentle unto all men, apt to teach, patient, In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;
objective: To understand that strife and conflicts are inevitable in our lives
INTRODUCTION: Even though believers in the world today are ensconced in the love of God through salvation, however, strife can arise, conflicts are bound to happen. Obedience to the word of God offers great help to believers in situations of strives and conflicts.
Discussion_title: Strife and Conflicts are bound to occur among people but believers should have an understanding that it's for a purpose

DISCUSSION.title: It affords us the opportunity to turn others unto righteousness
It is an opportunity for personal growth
God’s grace to endure through conflict
To initiate conflict resolution and forgiveness

CONCLUSION: Whatever God allows in the life of a believer, especially strives and conflicts, He makes appropriate provision and grace to overcome and come out victorious to the glory of His name

title: STRIFE AND CONFLICTS
subtitle: BIBLICAL STEPS TO RESOLVING STRIFES AND CONFLICTS
memory_verse: Eccl. 12:13 - Let us hear the conclusion of the whole matter: Fear God, and keep his commandments: for this is the whole duty of man.
objective: To understand God's position in every strife and conflicts
INTRODUCTION: The Bible has already established the fact that strife can arise either to us directly, as a group or among people we are leading or associated with, How we navigate through is essential in our Christian life and growth
Discussion_title: As ambassadors of peace, there is no better way to learn peacemaking than from the embodiment of peace Himself - Jesus Christ.

DISCUSSION.title: God is a God of justice and righteousness

CONCLUSION: One of the major and fundamental way of showing or expressing our Love to God, is through obedience to His Word as documented in the Bible and as Led by the spirit of God, may God Open Our eyes of understanding to things we need to do in order to avoid or manage conflicts in Jesus Name

title: STRIFE AND CONFLICTS
subtitle: BENEFITS OF WELL MANAGED STRIFES AND CONFLICTS
memory_verse: 2 Cor. 13:11 Finally, brethren, farewell. Be perfect, be of good comfort, be of one mind, live in peace; and the God of love and peace shall be with you.
objective: To understand and appropriate the Benefits of a well-managed Strife and Conflicts
INTRODUCTION: Managing strife effectively can lead to numerous positive outcomes, both on a personal level and within the broader context of communities and organizations.
Discussion_title: The benefits of strife properly managed

DISCUSSION.title: Leads to personal and spiritual growth/maturity

CONCLUSION: Managing conflict successfully isn't almost about ending the disputes, but changing conflicts into opportunities for development, understanding, and improved relationships. We will encounter these significant benefits and cultivate a more tranquil and profitable environment by tending to conflicts with wisdom, lowliness, and a commitment to reconciliation. Remember it is God's desire

title: KEEP YOURSELF PURE
subtitle: A COMMAND OR AN ADVICE
memory_verse: Matt 5:8 - Blessed are the pure in heart: for they shall see God
objective: To understand what purity is
INTRODUCTION: Purity is a quality of being clean, faultless, holy, blameless, uncompromised or unadulterated, and without evil thought or action. It also connotes holiness in the body and mind. A pure life is one in which sin no longer determines the choice one makes. Purity is important to God who alone is truly pure and holy. Therefore, He demands practical purity from every believer. Without holiness (purity) no man shall see God. Heb. 12:14.

DISCUSSION.title: Purity consists of innocence and clean hands.
Purity is being guiltless or blameless.

CONCLUSION: Purity is a command from God which believers must attain.

title: KEEP YOURSELF PURE
subtitle: STEPS TO A LIFE OF PURITY
memory_verse: Psalms 18:26 - With the pure thou wilt shew thyself pure; and with the froward thou wilt shew thyself froward
objective: To understand the privilege of the call to a life of purity
INTRODUCTION: Seeking purity in this world seems like you are kicking against the tide of popular opinion. Pure living does not only benefit the believers' life but also adds value to our society as a whole. Believers should not underestimate its value and the negative consequences of impurity.
Discussion_title: The following are the steps to a life of purity:

DISCUSSION.title: Develop a new heart: Impure heart produces impure actions.
Having a heart that fears and loves God.
Choose to live a transparent life.
Meditate on the word of God.

CONCLUSION: Believers should persevere and keep moving in living a life of purity; it is worth the effort.

title: KEEP YOURSELF PURE
subtitle: THE WAR AGAINST PURITY
memory_verse: Rom. 12:1 - I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, that ye present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable unto God, which is your reasonable service
objective: To understand the challenges of living a pure life.
INTRODUCTION: God created human beings to reflect His image and to live in pure, holy, and unbroken communion with Him. However, sin is the corruptor of purity. Christians must be aware of different ways the devil is working against living a pure life.
Discussion_title: Below are ways waging war against purity:
CONCLUSION: When our hearts are clouded with impurities, we cannot experience God's presence.

title: KEEP YOURSELF PURE
subtitle: LIVING AND KEEPING A LIFE OF PURITY
memory_verse: Psa. 24: 3-4 - Who shall ascend into the hill of the Lord? or who shall stand in his holy place? He that hath clean hands, and a pure heart; who hath not lifted up his soul unto vanity, nor sworn deceitfully
objective: To learn and understand the benefits of purity
INTRODUCTION: In order to have fellowship with a holy God, we must reclaim the purity that He originally intended for us. Once we have been born again through faith in Jesus, God desires that we should live purely in all our dealings with Him and men.
Discussion_title: Benefits of keeping a life of purity:

DISCUSSION.title: Keeping a life of purity is a pleasant before God.
It creates enjoyment of God's presence.
It helps you to live free of guilt and regret.
It governs your relationship with others, and enables you to provide an example to follow.

CONCLUSION: The benefits of living a pure life cannot be overemphasized. Holiness must be our lifestyle.
